result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodney C. Walczak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Damage Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(2).
  • Intentionally Point Firearm At Person [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Impairment of Physical Condition

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Probation on Ct 2 and Ct 5 in this same case is concurrent to each other as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.  Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.

Defendant is to undergo a psychological evaluation and follow up with any recommendations/treatments releasing all records to the agent.   Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.
No jail credit has been earned on this case as it is going to be applied to the revocation on case 15CM18.
Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rodney C. Walczak

records.addlTxt: Original Bond returned by Sherrif's Department unsigned / not posted.   the original and the amended
from DOC commuting the term of probation to 2 years on Ct 5.
Prosecutor Lyndsey A.B. Brunette and Defendant, Rodney C. Walczak, in custody, appeared with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson.    Waived reading of Information.

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State; and Defendant, Rodney C. Walczak, in custody, appeared with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Arraignment scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 10:20 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 21, 2016 at 11:10 am.

Prosecuting Atty Kerra Stumbris appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Paul M Fredrickson in court for Defendant Rodney C. Walczak.  Defendant Rodney C. Walczak appeared by video means from Clark County Jail.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 11:10 am.

Pre-trial conference on March 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on April 14, 2016 at 03:10 pm.

Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, Rodney C. Walczak from the Clark County Jail by video, appeared with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson. Victim S.C. was present and requested no contact restriction be lifted.  Court Amends bond to no person to person contact is allowed with S.C. except in accordance with Jail policy visitation and contact is allowed by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means with S.C.

Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, Rodney C. Walczak from the Clark County Jail by video, appeared with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson.   Defendant's Attorney acknowledged receipt of complaint and waived its reading.    Waived time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 03:10 pm.
from Victim/Witness coordinator to defendant indicating that victim would like no contact dropped with copy of letter from victim
from victim witness to Attorney Paul Fredrickson - victim wishes to lift the no contact with letter from victim

The defendant shall have no contact with S.C. or K.S.  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant shall not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.  Defendant must contact the Clark County Sheriff's Department within 48 hours to schedule and complete at the date and time designated by the Sheriff's Department, the booking process, which includes fingerprinting and photos.
AMENDED 3/17/16:  No person to person contact is allowed with S.C. except in accordance with Jail policy visitation and contact is allowed by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means with S.C.

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  Initial appearance scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 09:10 am.
of hearing from Clark County Jail for bail/bond hearing
